snippet: The stains left by those spitting out the leaves of paan, a popular after-dinner treat, have caused friction in the 74th Street commercial district in Queens.
abstract: Blood red stains left by those spitting out the leaves of paan, a popular after-dinner treat among South Asian immigrants, have caused friction, and ugly sidewalks, in Jackson Heights, Queens; city laws prohibit spitting in public, but shop owners say they have never seen anyone receive a violation; Sanitation Dept spokesperson promises that the city will pay closer attention to clean-up efforts.
lead_paragraph: The stains left by those spitting out the leaves of paan, a popular after-dinner treat, have caused friction in the 74th Street commercial district in Queens.

headline.seo: Messy Aftermath of Paan, After-Dinner Treat, Splits Jackson Heights, Queens
headline.main: On Jackson Heights Sidewalks, a Treat’s Messy Aftermath
headline.print_headline: Jackson Hts. Sidewalks Stained by a Messy Treat
